RT @SawyerMerritt: BREAKING: Apple to use Tesla batteries at California solar farm. $TSLA

The setup, which will store up to 240 megawatt-h…

2) Cars are a social signaling mechanism. They're an expression of identity. $TSLA might have a "better" car but that won't matter to people who don't see $TSLA as representative of their identity. They might dominate market share but 25-30% is frankly insane for any one brand.

I do think 2 $TSLA bull cases are weird: 1) Factoring robofleet into valuations. Who's operating the fleet? Tesla or the owners? And if there are robo cars everywhere there are fewer cars overall. You can't have both.
They'll eventually catch up. I just think it'll take a lot longer, and they might just decide licensing $TSLA's tech has a better roi.

I'm not sure what changes that. $TSLA is like a software company 1st, auto mfr 2nd. Working with A LOT of large companies in my career, almost none get software. At all. It's embarrassing actually. It's clear to me it requires different thinking / process.

Lots of hate on $TSLA these days. I think the "scam" takes are misplaced. Stock is optimistically priced and @elonmusk might over sell at times but that's a bonus imo as long as he ultimately delivers and so far he has.
